definitions.definition: a statement saying that you think a person is guilty of doing something wrong or illegal; the fact of accusing somebody
definitions.sensetop: accusation of somethingaccusation against somebodyaccusation that…

examples.text: I don't want to **make an accusation** until I have some proof.
There was a hint of accusation in her voice.
At the time, no one believed his accusations against her.
He denied the accusation that he had ignored the problems.
She was forced to defend herself against accusations of plagiarism.
New evidence has emerged which supports the accusations against them.
He made a lot of thinly veiled accusations.
She rejected all the accusations brought against her.
Their father now faces an accusation of murder.
There seem to be a lot of wild accusations flying around.
They have the nerve to level these accusations against one of our most respected members.
They sank into mutual accusation and incrimination.
You made a public accusation of misconduct against Nigel.
an accusation frequently levelled at junior doctors
They fled the country amid accusations of fraud.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Old French, from Latin accusatio(n-), from accusare ‘call to account’, from ad- ‘towards’ + causa ‘reason, motive, lawsuit’.
